Tested on mac using SWT HEAD stream. The problem does not happen. SWT is not 
using emulated table on Mac anymore. Tried it on Motif since the table is 
emulated but the problem did not happen.

Moving to SWT in case you want to check why the emulated table works on Motif 
but did not work on Mac.

Changing severity from blocking to normal as this is no longer an issue on the 
mac.

Note also that the WorkbenchEditorsDialog adds a layout relying on the 
existence of two TableColumns before creating the table columns.  There is no 
garauntee that the table will not invoke layout before the two columns have 
been created.  I would recommend moving the layout assignment to after the 
column creation.  

It seems odd that the creation of the first column resulted in a layout - this 
part we will investigate further.

Vikki, I'm going to close this as it doesn't happen any more.  If you want to 
reopen it, please assign it to someone for investigation.
